DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Osteoclast Targeted Therapy Use Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the use of osteoclast targeted therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Osteoclast Targeted Therapy Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A large, multinucleated cell that secretes bone-degrading enzymes in the processes of normal bone remodeling and pathological bone loss. Osteoclasts are derived from macrophages._A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments._To put into action or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A large, multinucleated cell that secretes bone-degrading enzymes in the processes of normal bone remodeling and pathological bone loss. Osteoclasts are derived from macrophages.:A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments.:To put into action or service.

Concepts.definition: A large, multinucleated cell that secretes bone-degrading enzymes in the processes of normal bone remodeling and pathological bone loss. Osteoclasts are derived from macrophages.

A type of cancer treatment that uses testing and medication to more precisely identify and treat cancer. These treatments target and disable genes or proteins necessary to the proliferation of cancer cells.
To put into action or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/9/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
